intro: Spatalla procera, commonly known as the tall spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are surrounded by colorful bracts that attract pollinators.
